Nightshift nods and heads over to where Prowl had asked him to go.=C2=A0 He=
 gets right to work on trying to restore functionability to the control pan=
nel.=C2=A0 At the same time, he looks for his special audio player to try a=
nd get some music going, but realizes he hasn't got it anymore.=C2=A0 
=C2=
=A0
"Aw slag, no digital radio.=C2=A0 I forgot, gave that up when I gave up=
 the wheels.=C2=A0 If I'm gonna do some serious work, I need some tunes ta =
work by."
=C2=A0
He looks around, and finds a pannel that resembles a radio=
 recieving station.=C2=A0 He then cracks his knuckles and gets to work on r=
estoring it.=C2=A0 
=C2=A0
" Let's see if this will work.=C2=A0"

Respect t=
hose as you wish to be respected.


________________________________
From: =
Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...>
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Sent: =
Friday, December 16, 2011 6:42 PM
Subject: Re: Frigid Callings


=C2=A0 
> =
<OLD>
>
> Nightshift looks over the circuit boards as he transforms into ro=
bot mode.
> " Oooh right up my alley. I used ta make new boards outa scrapp=
ed ones all
> the time in boot camp. This brings back memories. No sweat, I=
 totally got
> this. Hmm, old stuff.. Could use a little upgrading, which I=
 can do real
> easy. Man, I'm hav'n fun already."

<NEW>

PROWL looked arou=
nd his optics wide as he walked over to one of the
panels. "Hmmm." He said =
thoughtfully.

Actually what NIGHTSHIFT was looking at was cutting edge tec=
hnology.
Whatever this place was it was designed with among the best techno=
logy
that had been seen in a while. It was recognizable by NIGHTSHIFT, but
=
some of the things he was seeing was things he had only read about in
some =
of the theoretical text books never mind seen in actual action.

"If you'll=
 begin with that one over there." PROWL pointed to one of
the control panel=
, probrably one that routed the data. "I will work on
this one."

PROWL pop=
ped open his panel. "If we can get these up and running I
think we can at l=
east get the back up antenna up and running."

(TAG)

- Preston
